values: Ok, yea, so it has been a while, again. I know, every time I update I claim that I'll keep up with this thing, but I keep forgetting, lol. Anyhow, this update prolly wont be too long since there isn't too much to say. Let's see...I'm still in Alaska, and will be for the next 3 years, still with Mike and doing well, and still working on school. Alaska's "6 months of daylight" has come to an end and the season changed. We actually got snow this weekend. It was only about an inch accumulation total, but it was snowing non-stop all weekend. The temperature dropped to about 26 too. Although, it wasn't too bad cuz it was a dry cold, not that chill ya to the bones crap. I'm used to snow close to Christmas, not Halloween though, lol. The days are getting shorter as well. Right now we have what would be normal winter days for the lower 48 (i.e. slightly overcast all day with darkness creeping in around 5 or 6pm). I'm sure in a month or two we will be really hitting the "6 months of dark." The Northern Lights are slowly getting more visible. Nothing too spectacular yet so I don't have any pics, but if you go outside around 10pm you can see either a light green or red off in one corner of the sky. It's neat :) I'll be sure to send some pictures as soon as it gets really clear. Nothin much new in the me and Mike department. We have both been spending a lot of time playing Halo 3 (prolly me more than him) and just hangin around the house. Nothin major to report really. We are doing well and have been happier than we ever really were before. As for school, that is going well too. I got A's on the finals for all 4 of the classes I mentioned before and so I have a 4.0 GPA right now. I changed my major to Humanities, instead of English, which isn't that big a change, lol. Instead of taking a butt load of all English courses, now I get to spice it up with some History, Language, and other types of courses. I think it will be more fun. Plus, I'm contemplating working on a Graduate degree in Humanities with a focus on Asian Studies. That way I can try for a job at a museum, possibly as a curator if I get really ambitious, hehe. We shall see. Even if I opt not to go that route a Humanities degree will look good on just about any job application in the Business field, so whatever. I'm planning to step up my class-load next semester to speed along the process a bit. Mike and I are hurting for cash and so I volunteered to go back to work, but was told I'm not allowed, lol. So, instead, I plan to push myself to get through school quicker so I have no excuse for not working. I should have taken more courses this semester, but I thought it would be nice to breathe after that History of Japan class, which turned out to be a lot of fun but a LOT of work too. So I only signed up for 2 classes, but one is a 1/2 semester, 1 credit hour class. In fact, I only have like 1 more week before LIBS 150(Liberal Studies) is over. Then I'll just have HUMN 351, Myth and Culture, to finish up. The class is fun, but it is easy. So anyhow, next semester I'm signed up for PHIL 140 (Contemporary Moral Issues), SOCY 100 (Intro to Sociology), and IFSM 201 (Information Systems). I'll also be taking my Math placement exam as soon as the Army Ed. Center gets their computer system fixed so then I'll be signing up for whatever class they suggest for my Math pre-requisites. It ought to be an interesting semester. Well, I think that about covers everything. Oh, last thing, I gave into the evil of MySpace cuz a bunch of my family has it and I got tired of not being able to view all their blogs and shit. In any event, I posted some of the pics from the drive up from Washington on their. If you want to go see, here is the link: My Photo Album So, till next time :)

Why hello there my humble companions. How goes it? I know, I know hisashiburi desu ne (long time no see).  But, rest assured, from now on I will try to make a valiant effort at stopping by from time to time to throw out an update. That being said, let the show begin!! ;)

So, quick summary of points: 1-Mike and I have been back together for months now and doing better then ever, 2-Sherman and I are still great friends and drop each other a call when our hectic lives allow, 3- I had moved out to Washington to be with Mike, but after about 5 months we were moved and now I live in sunny Alaska.

Now, you will notice I used the word "sunny" to describe Alaska. This is because right now Alaska is in it's 6 months of light phases which translates to...THE SUN NEVER FUCKING SETS! Now, I don't mean that in an over-exaggerating, making shit up kinda way. I mean that in the sun truly never sets sorta way. Right now it's 4pm and looks like high noon. In a few hours it will be 9pm and it will STILL look like high noon. By about 11pm it will start to look like evening (4-7ish) and by 2am it might be dark enough out to be considered "sundown" and it will stay this way for a bit. However, by 4pm it will start looking like "sunrise" again and by 5am it will look like late-morning (9-11ish). Wash, rinse, repeat. Of course, this is only half the year, I'll let ya know how the 6 months of dark thing goes, lol.

So, anyhow, I've been living in Alaska for a couple weeks now and so far so good. The weather is nice this time of year, there is some breathtaking scenery, and the people seem pretty laid back. Mike and I have agreed that people run on "Alaskan time" up here, which is about 15-20minutes slower than anywhere else in the world, hehe. Mike sat in line at a drive through for almost 20 minutes one day and he was the only person in line.  Speaking of scenery, by the way, Mike and I ended up driving up here from Washington (in separate vehicles mind you) and I have some pictures of some absolutely gorgeous scenery and a shitload of wildlife. The drive was spectacular! I hate driving long distance and even I couldn't help but enjoy it, lol. I'll post pictures just as soon as we get all the film developed.

On another note, for those of you who don't know, I've finally gone back to school. I'm attending UMUC online and going for a B.A. in English with a minor in Asian Studies. Right now I'm finishing up my first semester which consisted of ENGL240 (Poetry, Drama & Fiction) and JAPN111 (Elementary Japanese I). Plus, my summer semester started 2 weeks ago so I'm also taking HIST483 (History of Japan Since 1800) and ASTD150 (Asian Studies I). I know my class order is a lil odd since I'm practically finishing my minor before my main degree, but I had to wait for my military ed. to be evaluated and it left my struggling to find an offered online course that I knew I would need to take. In any event, I've been hella busy lately with the 4 classes and as it is, I'm only typing now cuz I'm in need of a break, lol. But, both English and Japanese language end in a week so I'll have more time after that. Just have to pass those finals first.....I think I'll be fine with English, but Japanese is gonna cause some issues. I know the basics, but there is a LOT of the class I just don't understand or can't seem to remember off the top of my head. Luckily I've aced every other part of the class so even if I blow the final, I should still pass the class. hehe

Wow, this is turning into a longer post than I expected. Heh, probably has something to do with not wanting to go read any more Asian Studies or "Death of a Salesman," lol. Oh well, whatcha gonna do, I mean really? :)

So, let's see, what else is new...anooo(ummm)....aa (oh!), I've picked up some new interests thanks to Mike and my friend Eka. 1- I'm a huge Naruto and Bleach freak now, 2- I find myself spending more and more money every time I visit a comic book store, and 3- I'm gonna go fucking broke with all the manga and anime I'm buying as of late. To go into further detail, thanks to Mike's MASSIVE interest in comic books (Deadpool in particular) I've started to find comics I like as well. For example, the Laurell K. Hamilton series I read devotedly has it's own Anita Blake comic series now. Plus, there is a series called Ninjas vs. Pirates. I mean, Helloooooo, NINJAS versus FUCKING PIRATES!! Who could resist that one??? I'm not unbreakable damnit!! So, despite my best efforts, I've started reading some of Mike's Deadpool series and rather liked it. Now I've completely given into the dark side and have vowed to read all Mike's Deadpool comics in addition to the two series I plan to collect for me.  As for manga, that is thanks to both Mike and Eka, although I think Eka played a greater role. The damn girl felt the need to bring a new one in every week practically and then tell me all about it!! Christ, I can't live under these conditions! So, now I am reading Helsing, Berserk, Basilisk, Judas, and Rebirth, among others that I can't recall thier names right this second. In addition to this, I have read ALL the Naruto manga (Japanese version w/ translations) online and wait patiently each week for the newest translated edition. Plus, I have watched every Naruto/Naruto:Shipuuden AND Bleach episode meaning that once again I wait patiently each week for the newest translated episode. As if all that is not bad enough, I've developed such a fascination with anime/manga that I've started watching/reading various other series that aren't as popular (at least not in the U.S.) I truly think there was a conspiracy to turn a helpless book geek into an all out nerdy geek!! 

My future children are truly doomed to be the laughing stock of the school. I mean, look at who their parents will be. Dad faithfully watches WWE wrestling, reads comic books, reads the occasional fiction book, reads manga/watches some anime, and plays an abundance of video games. And mom reads more books then we have bookshelves, also watches some wrestling, reads some comic books, faithfully watches anime/reads manga, and when a video game attracts her attention will go days doing nothing but playing. LOL, he/she is SO destined to be just as big of a nerdy geek!! hehehe, poor kid.

Anyhow, I really should finish up school work and I'm sure you are tired of reading. So, off I go. Ja mata (See you later)

Why do I always do this? How do I always hurt those I care about? Why am I like this?! How does one person manage to hurt everyone that has ever cared for her? FUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUCK! I want to scream and throw things. I want to cry, well, technically, I've got that covered already, but I want to scream too. I am nothing more than a coward. A spineless little coward. I run from everything. I use people. I'm no better than Fred. The going gets tough and I hall ass. Joe once told me a long time ago that "if I faced the Army with the same cowardice that I approached our relationship that I was sure to fail." Only now, all these years later, does it make sense. I did fail. I fail a lot of things. I didn't make it through Basic Training, I scraped by because the Drills liked me and felt sorry for me. I barely made it outta AIT. I gave up in Pensacola. I quit. I did fail. Then I failed with Mike. I ruined us, more than once. I don't know how or why he sees a reason to take me back after everything. I wouldn't. If it had been the other way around, I wouldn't have been able to forgive him. Why? I don't deserve forgiveness. God, I hurt so many people. I gave up Joe cuz I was afraid of the Army and cuz I jumped into things with him without thinking them through. I led him on and dumped him. I did the same thing to Adam and Sherman. Sherman's hurting because I got confused and bailed. I ran away from Drew too. God, he may have had his own problems and I just bailed. Don't think I'm giving him an excuse for what he did, but I should have at least called his ass instead of an email. But Sherman, yea, that one takes the cake. The only real friend who has ever understood me and I used him. I hurt him. Just like I hurt the others. What is wrong with me? Why do I ruin every good thing in my life? I had a feeling that trying to date Sherman would backfire. I knew it would ruin us. I knew it and I ignored it. Now look! He can't talk to me cuz he gets upset. I can't talk to him cuz I get upset. He blames himself when it's really my fault. All he ever did was care and I'm the one who changed.I'm the one ruining his happiness because I can never make up my mind about what or who will make me happy. Hell, I never know what will make me happy and every time I think I find it, I throw it away. AGH! I can't do this right now....I'm going to lay down and stare at the ceiling till morning.
Ah...Depression my old friend. I wondered when I would see you again. I only wish I knew why you were here.......

So, I decided to get a sample reading done and here are the results. I'm gonna highlight the things that seem to hit home the most for me. Maybe ya'll will gain a bit of incite that I have not yet been able to put into words accurately. (Sorry it skips around, it was only a sample reading so they don't show you most of it) Chapter 1: Your Heart and Soul - The Real You The Sun is in Gemini. The Sun was in Gemini at the time of your birth. However, reading your birth chart will show you the many other astrological factors that also influence your personality and the way you behave. Put them together and they give you a complete picture of the many astrological influences that make up your unique personality. Even if you live to be a hundred, life will be far too short for you to cram into it all the experiences and knowledge that you'd like. People, places, and all sorts of subjects fascinate and inspire you, because you're always open to new ideas and influences. What's more, you love communicating them to others, whether you have a good gossip with a neighbour, spend hours on the telephone or put all your thoughts down on paper. You love using your brain, and you're very intelligent, but sometimes your insatiable curiosity gets the better of you, and you're side tracked on to yet another new train of thought. That means you can flit from one subject to the next like a butterfly, leaving a trail of unfinished conversations, hobbies, or evening classes behind you! If you want to make the most of your stunning potential, then you need to cultivate your concentration and try to avoid being so easily distracted! Words usually flow from your lips with no effort at all, but sometimes you can get carried away and start embellishing the truth, just to give some added interest to what you're saying. Take care, though, that folk don't accuse you of lying, or start to disbelieve everything you say. You're top of the popularity polls, because folk enjoy your quick wit and lively mind and find you fun to be with. You're never lost for words (in fact sometimes you barely pause for breath!) and try to keep up to date with the latest books, films and news. There's never a dull moment when you're around, because you're always changing from one mood to the next. One moment you'll be feeling doom laden and depressed, and the next you'll be laughing and joking as though you hadn't a care in the world. All this chopping and changing can make you very highly strung unless you make an effort to relax and soothe those jangled nerves. One thing you're never short of is a host of friends and acquaintances, all of which appeal to different aspects of your multifaceted personality, from serious to superficial. Being tied down to one place, living with a possessive partner who wants to know your every move or having a tedious nine-to-five job are just three of the things that will make you feel frustrated, suffocated and desperate for escape. You also have a very low boredom threshold, and don't suffer fools gladly! Happiness for you is feeling free and unhampered by restrictions or rules, and that often goes for your emotions, too. Because you live so much in your mind, strong feelings and desires can frighten you, since they mean that you're no longer in control or are unable to think in your usually rational and logical way. You need to learn more about your own emotions, and realise that you won't look weak or silly if you admit to the way you really feel about something or someone. Everyone has emotions, so why not start admitting to yours? Chapter 2: Your Persona and Image - How Others See You The Rising sign is Gemini. Versatility is your middle name, and you have a list of interests, hobbies, and studies that's as long as your arm! In fact, you're happy to have a go at almost anything that takes your fancy, just to see what it's like. Therefore, you know a little about almost every subject under the sun, and are a real expert when it comes to your job or favourite pastime! In fact, you have the best of both worlds because, although you're always open to new suggestions and love discovering new things, you don't flit from one idea to another like a restless butterfly. Instead, you have quite a strong sense of purpose and so can remain interested in something for quite a long time! By the time, you've finished it, another subject will have caught your eye, and you'll be off on a different track! After all, you know secretly just how restless and unsettled you can feel sometimes, and you may need to curb your fancy-free spirit a wee bit. Where relationships are concerned, you need all the freedom you can get! You shudder at the thought of being tied down to someone who always wants to know what you're thinking and what you've been up to. You're not going to tell them, so the sooner they get used to the idea, the better! Instead of feeling that the two of you are bound together hand and foot, you prefer to think that you're friends and soulmates who let each other live their own lives. Every now and then, you can't resist taking a risk or accepting a challenge it all adds spice to what's already a very exciting and invigorating life! Chapter 7: Your Energy and Libido - Your Ego Mars is in Gemini. Intellectual energy is bubbling away inside you, making you tremendously talkative and always alert. You're rarely stuck for something to say, especially during arguments or heated debates! Because communications of all kinds appeal to you, you probably love writing long chatty letters to all your far off friends and family or getting away from it all by having a jolly good read. Something that you find difficult is concentrating on one thing at a time almost anything can distract you, making you feel restless and all set to move on to something else. Therefore, you prefer work that offers lots of variety, and will change jobs several times rather than stick at one thing for years at a time. Just make sure that you finish one project before embarking on the next, or you'll be surrounded by loose ends! Even so, you can often do two things at once, which keeps things nice and interesting! You're a wee bit flighty when it comes to amour, losing interest quickly and being too flirtatious for words. Chapter 11: Your Spirituality and Fantasies - The Psychic You Neptune is in Sagittarius. You can be very philosophical and inspired at times, so make the most of your sagacious talents, which can stand you in very good stead.

Ok, upon re-reading that last entry, I realized that despite my best efforts not to lash out at Mike, I did anyhow. So, I have decided to clear some things up in my head. I'm going to list my major faults during the course of this relationship and next time I feel the need to lash out, I'm going to re-read this list and tell myself to shut the hell up...that's the plan anyhow. So here goes:

1- Even in the very beginning, I had a hard time committing myself completely to Mike. Perhaps a trust issue on my part.

2- Six months into the relationship, Mike and I had a huge argument and I cheated on him (Jay). More importantly, I didn't tell him about it till 2 days later when he was apologizing for the fight. Quite a bit of immaturity on my part.

3- I harp on things. For example, Mike's driving. I don't like how he drives, so instead of saying my piece and letting it go, I harped on it. A lot. Typical nagging woman issues.

4- I dwell on things. The only way I know how to solve any of my problems is to dwell on them. Not that this is entirely bad, but when I take it to the extreme it can make mountains out of mole hills.

5- I can't always express myself correctly. I tend to fear other people's reactions to what I will say and so sometimes I keep things in to prevent them from hurting someone. When in reality, if I just talked about it in the first place I might have prevented an argument.

6- I'm manic depressive and most likely have an anxiety disorder. Now, I know neither of these are faults per say, but refusing to seek help with these issues IS a problem. I hate doctors. So, instead of going to therapy, I put it off and deal with things my way. Well, we all know my way isn't always the healthiest way.

7- I have no self esteem. I tend to blame myself for things that are not my fault and things that are my fault, I sometimes try to turn around on others. If I had more confidence in myself, I would be a better person at handling the everyday issues of the rest of the world.

8- They say you can't truly let someone else in until you learn to love yourself. This is true for me. I hurt those I love because I don't know how to love myself and thus don't truly know how to love others. That's not to say my intentions aren't good, but we all know what happens to good intentions.

9- I lack a certain degree of patience...I know that's putting it mildly, lol...ok, I'm incredibly impatient. Let's be honest here, right?

10- I'm stubborn. Now this can also be termed as I'm a bitch. Both true at times...when I think I'm right it's VERY difficult to convince me otherwise. Furthermore, I tend to get crabby at people that don't see things my way. Not to say that I don't try to understand others points of view, but I do sometimes lack the maturity to admit when I'm wrong without being bitchy about it.

Ok, so the list can go on and on, but I'm not looking to have a pity fest or make myself feel like shit here. The top 10 things I can think of off the top of my head should suffice. So, I apologize for sounding testy in that last entry. I had no right to lash back, Mike. I shouldn't have said some of those things. I'm sorry. But, hopefully, this entry will help act as a reminder to myself that I'm not perfect and I wont be so quick to get defensive.

Well, Mike's pissed at me...which, technically is an expected response, right? I dunno, it's weird though. Like, he sent me an email the other day asking me to explain everything that has happened. He didn't understand why I called things off. I tried, again, to explain it to him, but he only seems to focus on the parts that are easy to get angry about. Not that I blame him, that's a normal human response. We all try to only focus on the things that suit our mood at the time. But, it's bigger than that. I read his online journal today and he's not just mad at me, he's downright furious. He calls me a liar. He says I deceived him our entire relationship. Now granted, I have said some similar things about some of my ex-relationships that I felt wronged by, but this wasn't any of those relationships. This was a 4 year relationship with someone that I truly loved...not puppy love, not a crush. I dunno, I mean, I have screwed up in the past. Yes, I cheated on him, twice. Things got bad and I ran to someone else. I'm not perfect. Then again, neither is he. I told him about my little one-night flings after they happened, it may have taken me a couple months, but it came out. He on the other hand had a whole second relationship on the side that lasted for a month and the only reason why he told me about it was because I was crying on the phone one day and asked that we always be honest from now on. So he fessed up to something he had done 3 YEARS ago. How do you keep a secret like that for 3 years? More importantly, how do you throw my mistakes back in my face constantly and talk about havin a lack of trust in me, when you did the same damned thing? I have never thrown that back in his face. I found out a whopping 2 months ago and have not once thrown it in his face, because it wasn't important. Yet, he continued to throw my mistake with C. (see, I can be nice and leave names out of it when I want to, hehe) back in my face, not to mention Jay. And now, he stands ready to accuse me of having an affair with an old friend just because I called the marriage off. Yes, Cormier and I have been talking again, yes, I flew out to Colorado (which I told him about) for a weekend, but hell nothing happened. I had a good time. That's the plain and simple truth. I went out there and just had a good time being myself. He calls this running away. I call this not dwelling on my problems to the point of them killing me inside and out. I have spent my whole life as a manic depressive. Just once in my life, I'd like to wake up in the morning and know that life will go on. And damn it, is that so fucking bad? I don't think so....

God this whole thing is just so frustrating. How can he honestly believe that I never loved him? Because he read a couple journal entries on here written when I was angry? I mean, really, how often do I even post on this damned thing?? Four years of trying to show him I loved him, and he says that was a lie? Four years of trusting him COMPLETELY, when he didn't deserve any more trust than he gave me. Four years of memories and he here we sit...on different sides of the world...not understanding each other any better than we did on day 1...scared and lonely....maybe that's just me. According to him I was only using him for the medical benefits. Which makes perfect sense if you think about the fact that I didn't want to get married so young. I didn't want to get married early for the money. I didn't want to get married precisely for that reason. But, no, clearly I only did it for the medical. I'm lashing out. I know...I shouldn't be. This is his battle and I don't need to fight him. It's just painful to hear some of the things he says about me now. Has he always felt that way and just never said anything? I think that's what bothers me most. It's just not knowing if these are old thoughts about webs of lies and deceit that are only just now fully coming to light or is he only speaking out of anger? He thinks I blame him for everything. I don't. I don't know how to make him see that. I have tried to explain to him why my journal entries all point the blame at him, but he doesn't understand. I write only when I'm upset. And, when I'm upset, it's easy to point the finger. I mean, who wants to blame themselves, right? We all do it. Isn't that what he is doing now? Trying to get back at me? He feels wronged and is lashing out. I understand this. It's just hard to hear some of the thoughts that go through his head.

Mike thinks that Cormier is a rebound. Can I blame him? no...but he's not. I'm not sitting by the phone waiting for him to call me. I'm not pining over him. Am I looking forward to his possible visit in February? Yes. And why? because he has always been good at helping me work through my problems. The entire time I was in CO for that weekend, ya know what I talked about? My failing marriage. I would start talking and get lost in thought or be on the verge of tears. And for the first time in a long time, I had an old friend there to help me cheer back up. That's what friends do right? Help cheer each other up? So why does that <italic>obviously</italic> mean that I'm looking to jump back into a relationship with him? I remember what happened all those years ago. I remember the old girlfriend and the way I got played. I'm not stupid thank you very much. Even if I wasn't with Mike and Cormier just popped back in my life, I would not jump head first into a relationship with him for just that reason. The fact that I currently have a full plate trying to cope with my soon to be ex-marriage is plenty enough reason for me not to jump into ANY relationships. But, Mike insists that this must have been going on for months now. I have been planning on leaving him for 6 months now to run to an affair with someone that I only started talking to again about a week ago. There is no way for me to prove that to him is there? Nothing I can say will help this. Nothing will change his mind. So, what do I do? Let him vent and tell the world I'm a slut in his journal? Eh, looking like the only choice. Heh, it's funny that he's even got friends who have volunteered to spy on me. Why is that necessary? What would that accomplish? I have been nothing but honest with him about Cormier. I didn't have to tell him I was in CO, but I did. I didn't have to tell him Cormier might visit the end of Feb., but I did. In fact, right now, I don't have to even respond to his emails, but I do. I could very well just stop talking to him altogether. I could stop trying to help him answer all the questions he has. I could leave him to fend for himself....maybe that would be best, but hell, I still care about him and seeing him in this much pain kills me. So, what do I do? I set myself up to be punched around so that he can feel better. So be it. I'm a big girl. And despite popular belief, I think I'm handling this whole situation very well, considering I could be fighting back. I could be sitting here blaming him the way he blamed me, but I'm not going to. What's done is done and I can't take back the things I've done or said. So, well, just keep your fingers crossed that we all walk away from this with as few injuries as possible....

So yea, it's been a while, I know...and a lot has happened. Everything goes around in circles with me. Mike and I are bad, then we get better, then I realize that I'm still having a hard time accepting that everything can change. I can't entirely explain why or how my marriage just came to a screeching halt...I can assure you that it hurts like hell though. I dunno...it's...maybe it is all me. I know I have anxiety and manic-depression problems, but what if Mike was right and I am over-analytical and borderline delusional? I don't blame Mike for everything that has happened, even though I can't convince him of that...I mean, I know I have my problems too...things just got so bad after 4 years that I just, I couldn't handle it anymore. Perhaps it was quitting on my part or running away, but I was miserable. I felt like we were always together, but I was always alone. Then we call it off and go our separate ways for a month. But during this time he is trying, he is trying to show me he loves me. I start to hope that things might improve. I'm not sure that things will, but I hope and I pray. He comes home for 2 weeks and it's great...he deploys and it's ok. We talk about whatever...nothing overly important, but we talk. Things go well for 3 weeks or so. Then, we start to run out of things to talk about...conversations get spaced out with no explanations as to why...I start feeling awkward and helpless again...and there begins all the doubts and fears that I had never gotten over. I started asking questions to myself again. Were we only doing well cuz we weren't together? Everytime we had to live together we stopped talking, so was this just because we were in seperate places again? Did he really understand why I was so upset in the first place? Was he just trying to make me think he recognized the problems I did or was he only saying that out of fear of me leaving? I tried to push them all down again. I spent a whole weekend asking myself why I felt this way again. I talked to my mother...she says I have problems with fully committing. I talked to friends...they said I had made up my mind in August and that's why the doubts were back. All in all, most people tried to get off the phone quickly. No one wanted to talk about it anymore..."make your choice and stick with it", "quit being so melodramatic", "you're just like your father sometimes"....what if it is all true? I can't help the way I feel can I? If you're not happy and dragging the other person down with you, what choice do you have? I hurt him.......I never wanted to hurt him...I tried to show him that not everyone was evil and all I managed to do was re-affirm his worst fears....I made it worse....How do you say you're sorry for that? How do you even begin to make that right again? You don't...you can't...you can only live with your failures and regret your wrong-doings towards others.

So, it's over...it hurts...It hurts most because I know he hurts and it's my fault he hurts...I want to hold him and comfort him, but that would give him hope...that would give me hope. He's tired of living off "my hopes"...I don't blame him...I know he will find someone better. He deserves it. We both made mistakes...I know this....I just hope I figure out how to not make those same mistakes again someday...I fucked up....I was not only not-perfect, but I did to him what Fred did to me...he feels used and I made him feel that way. he feels betrayed and I made him feel that way. he feels lost and I made him feel that way....I can't fix this. I don't know how anymore. I asked for help, but the gods turned a deaf ear...it's ok though...I knew they would...I ask now that they help Mike. I just want him to be happy...I hate seeing his pain, hate feeling his pain, hate knowing that I AM his pain....I still wear my ring. My ring is my punishment for failing. I know I will take it off at some point and I will ask him if he wants it back...it's the right thing to do, to return it....but for now, it reminds me of my failings, it reminds me of the pain I caused him. I have always loved him...I always will...but I can't be his everything when I'm my own worst enemy....I need to get me in order...I should have done that before I got involved with him...I can't expect a marriage to succeed when I have so many failings of my own...but I was naive. I wanted to believe in a "happily-ever-after" regardless of who I am....I was wrong and I hurt the one person I cared most about because of this....I am sorry...it wont ever be enough, but I am sorry....I tried not to hurt him...I failed....perhaps that will be my destiny, to fail....I hope I don't bring anyone else down with me......

As I head off to Baghdad for the final weeks of my stay in Iraq, I wanted to say thanks to all of you who did not believe the media. *Over 400,000 kids have up-to-date immunizations.
*School attendance is up 80% from levels before the war.
*Over 1,500 schools have been renovated and rid of the weapons stored there so education can occur.

*Over 4.5 million people have clean drinking water for the first time ever in Iraq.
*The country now receives 2 times the electrical power it did before the war.
*100% of the hospitals are open and fully staffed, compared to 35% before the war.
*Elections are taking place in every major city, and city councils are in place.
*Sewer and water lines are installed in every major city.
*Over 60,000 police are patrolling the streets.
*Over 100,000 Iraqi civil defense police are securing the country.
*Over 80,000 Iraqi soldiers are patrolling the streets side by side with US soldiers.
*Over 400,000 people have telephones for the first time ever

*An interim constitution has been signed.
*Girls are allowed to attend school.
*Textbooks that don't mention Saddam are in the schools for the first time in 30 years.

Don't believe for one second that these people do not want us there. I have met many, many people from Iraq that want us there, and in a bad way. Ray Reynolds, SFC

I gotta tell you, a lot has happened these last couple days. I mean, it's amazing how things seem to work out sometimes. God, so much to tell and I have no idea where to begin, lol...ok, first, let's start with yesterday:

I get to work yesterday and Jodi (our civ. tech) tells me that the Cordova Mall is having this fundraiser for the American Cancer Society. You can go donate hair to Locks of Love so they can make wigs for children with cancer. Well, my hair has gotten quite long, I mean, it almost went all the way to my waist. So, yea, I love my long hair and had no intentions of cutting it, but Fox (co-worker/best friend), she has this little cousin, Gabe, who has Leukemia. And, well, poor Gabe lost all his hair during Chemo. and as I'm sitting there thinking about all my hair, I'm seeing his picture she showed me, all bright, cheerful, and all smiles...with no hair. Well, I decided to call down to the mall and get the details. And, yes, I did it. I donated 10 inches of may hair to Locks of Love...it made me feel so good too. I mean, I just kept picturing poor Gabe and remembering Fox telling me that he had overcome his cancer and his hair was finally growing back in when he got sick again. The poor kid had to start Chemo. again and lost all his hair for the second time in his short life. I just, I can't imagine what that must feel like..to be sick and feeling so terrible, but on top of that to have to face the world looking different than everyone else too. Ya, so, I think I'm going to start growing my hair out every year so that I can cut it and donate it to the Cancer Society. I was blessed with long, thick hair for a reason and I never understood until yesterday what that reason was. I almost forgot how good it feels to do things for others...

Anyhow, my next story is a bit different, but no less touching. Ok, so, I'm running clinic today with Dr. Zettler and this older man comes in with his cat for annual vaccines. Well, I ask how he is doing and he's says he's "still kicking." Well, this man turns out to be a retired Army veteran. He served 22 years and worked his way up from enlisted to Chief Warrant Officer. At 85 years old, this poor man had more war stories and battle wounds than you could ever imagine. He told Dr. Z and I about his tour in WWII, how he met Gen. Douglas MacArthur, how he became a POW for 3 years. This man, was abused so badly as a POW that they broke the femur head in his hip. He stayed 3 months in a death ward of a POW camp with a 103 temp before a doctor finally tossed him a towel said "chew on this" and took a razor blade to the abscess that formed on his hip. He told us about his first kill. He told us he killed 6 other men, but missed the one above him that dropped a grenade at his feet!!! He has scars, wounds, back aches and pains from grenades and POW abuse. I mean, can you imagine? This man saw the Baton Death March from the banks of the other side of the bay and didn't know until later what he was witnessing. He served in Korea before the war ended. He showed us a card he had that had a picture of all his medals. He has 3 Purple Hearts, a POW medal, about 6 other various war medals, about 10 International medals (one of which has 51 battle stars on it). And that doesn't include all the regular ribbons he got just from serving in the places he did.

I don't know how to explain it, but it was awe inspiring. To actually meet a living piece of history. To talk to a man who not only saw those wars first hand, but lived through more ordeals than anyone could imagine in their nightmares. I gotta tell ya, history class does those wars no justice. There is so much more to the stories than you can learn from a history class or two. I just, I was surprised at how open this guy was to sharing all his experiences, but ya know, Tom put that into perspective for me...he made the comment that the man was talking "to his own." You don't realize it, but unless you have served in the service, there are just some things that you will never understand. I can't relate to him about a lot of what he said, but there is an unspoken bond between service members. I wanted to stand up and salute this man for making it so I can live in freedom. And, he didn't do anything so spectacular that he got his name in the books, but he's a war hero. He saved more lives than I could even imagine. It's men like him that keep our flag flying high. God, I have never been so proud to be a soldier. I'm not saying that the Army is what is best for me, but I am so proud that I had the chance to do my part at keeping this country moving. Maybe I never saw war and maybe I never fired a M16 in self-defense, but I was (even for a short time) a part of the greatest fighting force the world has ever seen. I kept Working Dogs healthy that detect bombs that could kill people. I keep infectious diseases from spreading to our soldiers so that they can keep fighting to protect our country. These are small things that you don't realize in your day-to-day life. I mean, I have a normal job. I do paperwork and work as a Veterinary technician, but I am so much more than that and I tend to forget sometimes how important of a job I have. I'm a soldier and I'm proud to be able to say that I share a bond with men like the one I met today. 

You appreciate life a little more when it all gets put into perspective for you. I'm healthy, I'm alive, I'm doing something useful with my life...and, even when I get out, no one can take that away from me...ever!
